NAME: Swapnil Saraswat
ROLLNO: 2101CS76
COURSE: CS209-CS210 Architechture LAB
INSTRUCTOR NAME: Dr. Jimson Matthew

Algorithm: Multiplication of 2 positive integers
INPUT FILE:
loop1: 
	ldc res	; Load res address
   ldnl 0   ; Load res value into A
   adc var1 ; Add var1 value to A
   ldc res  ; Load res address
   stnl 0   ; Store A into res
   ldc var2 ; Load var2 address 
   ldnl 0   ; Load var2 value into A
   adc -1   ; Decrement A by 1
   ldc var2 ; Load var2 address 
   stnl 0   ; Store A into var2
   ldc var2 ; Load var2 address 
   ldnl 0   ; Load var2 value into A
   brz exit ; Branch to exit if A = 0
   br loop1 ; Banch to loop1 otherwise
exit: 
	HALT     ; Terminate 

var1: SET 2
var2: data 3
res: data 0

OUTPUTS:
1) LISTING FILE
0000000                         loop1
0000000     00001100      ldc res
0000001     00000004      ldnl 0x0
0000002     00000201      adc var1
0000003     00001100      ldc res
0000004     00000005      stnl 0x0
0000005     00001000      ldc var2
0000006     00000004      ldnl 0x0
0000007     FFFFFF01      adc 0xff
0000008     00001000      ldc var2
0000009     00000005      stnl 0x0
000000a     00001000      ldc var2
000000b     00000004      ldnl 0x0
000000c     0000010F      brz exit
000000d     FFFFF211      br loop1
000000e                         exit
000000e     00000012      HALT
000000f                         var1
000000f     000002       SET 0x2
00000010                         var2
00000010     00000003      data 0x3
00000011                         res
00000011     00000000      data 0x0
2) LOG FILE
No errors in Pass 1

3) Object code
00000000000000000001000100000000
00000000000000000000000000000100
00000000000000000000001000000001
00000000000000000001000100000000
00000000000000000000000000000101
00000000000000000001000000000000
00000000000000000000000000000100
11111111111111111111111100000001
00000000000000000001000000000000
00000000000000000000000000000101
00000000000000000001000000000000
00000000000000000000000000000100
00000000000000000000000100001111
11111111111111111111001000010001
00000000000000000000000000010010
000000000000000000000010NULL
00000000000000000000000000000011
00000000000000000000000000000000
4) Memory dump before execution

00000000 00001100 00000004 00000201 00001100
00000004 00000005 00001000 00000004 ffffff01
00000008 00001000 00000005 00001000 00000004
0000000c 0000010f fffff211 00000012 00000200
00000010 00000003 00000000

5) Memory dump after execution

00000000 00001100 00000004 00000201 00001100
00000004 00000005 00001000 00000004 ffffff01
00000008 00001000 00000005 00001000 00000004
0000000c 0000010f fffff211 00000012 00000200
00000010 00000000 00000006

6) Trace
